reviewText: Not too many movies around that have this kind of exuberance. This moves like a freight train but you might not want to get out of the way.Here's the scoop. Yul Perkins (writer/director Dax Shepard) is in the witness protection program with Tom Arnold as his protector. His girlfriend Annie Bean (Kristen Bell) has received a once in a lifetime job offer in Los Angeles. Does Yul break cover for the girl he loves, and if he does, what are the consequences?I found this entirely engaging. The set up is pretty basic, but, as in any good plot, the details are doled out slowly so the picture becomes more subtle and involved as things progress. Yul is a cool character. He is truly trying to turn his life around and his girl Annie is a big part of that. They have some very witty, Tarantino-esque conversations. They feel good together. The other characters are written well also. Brad Cooper, as Alex Dimitri, is a real card. Too many movies write their villains as shallow, and/or stupid tough guys. He's anything but. His dog food scene alone is worth the price of admission. About the weakest link here is Tom Arnold.  I like Tom Arnold. He plays a good second banana, but he is simply too inept to be a Federal Marshall. This is a crazy bunch of people with their own back stories, but the way all the factions come together is really cool and unexpected. Yes there's tension but these folks aren't just shooting at each other and threatening each other. They're having these really great conversations. The car chase scenes are directed really well. Car chases are such old news, it's always good to see some that rise above the fray.This is a way fun movie. It's tense, funny, clever, well acted and well directed. Is it great art? No. But it delivers, in spades, what it sets out to deliver.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Charlie is in a Witness Protection program, after he ratted out his gang members, who are all bank-robbers. His location is in California as he tries to keep a low profile. But then, he meets Annie, who is a professor and on the verge of losing her job. Charlie falls in love with Annie, and he follows her to L.A., where she seeks a new job. The drama begins as Charlie steps out of his Protective boundary,and all hell breaks loose as the chase begins. A former friend, also a marshal, and a member of his bank-robber gang go after Charlie at full-speed. Most of the scenes are very funny, and some laugh-out-loud entertainment, combined with romance. Superb acting performance, and just enough action. A great summer movie to enjoy. Highly recommended to all comedy lovers!
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Have you ever watched a movie in which all the characters sounded a little too erudite? Everyone in this goofy thing sounds as though he or she is a college-educated sociologist with a bit of new-age jargon thrown in. It was nice to hear, but I had to wonder if that was the intention of screenwriter Dax Shepard ("Brother's Justice") or if he lacks the skill to write more varied and authentic dialogue.This is a high-octane road race between a wide variety of muscle cars, custom-built race cars and one sturdy SUV, all because a former getaway driver (for bank robbers) who is in the Witness Protection Program, has promised to drive his sweetheart to a job interview 600 miles away, and nothing, not her ex-boyfriend, not his former gang members, not his dad, not a U.S. Marshall, nor his girlfriend's change of heart, can stop him.We see:* Kristen Bell ("Big Miracle") specializes in conflict resolution. She has a great job opportunity IF she can get to her Los Angeles interview in time. She thinks her boyfriend witnessed a crime.* Dax Shepard ("When in Rome") admitted to his girlfriend he was in the Witness Protection Program, but he failed to mention that he was an accomplice in those crimes.* Bradley Cooper ("Limitless") spent some painful time in jail because our hero ratted him out. Now he's mad! (But he loves dogs and doesn't want to see them fed inferior dog food.)* Joy Bryant ("Welcome Home, Roscoe Jenkins"), our hero's former girlfriend, is part of that bank-robbing gang, AND she's a pretty fair shot!* Beau Bridges ("The Descendants") is our hero's father. The two of them used to race custom-built cars.* Tom Arnold ("Madea's Witness Protection") is the U.S. Marshall determined to protect his witness. This character could give the U.S. Marshall Service a bad name!* John Duff ("The Game Plan") is the body builder in the clichéd tank top who buys cheap dog food for his pit bull.In this R-rated comedy, expect constant profanity, some nudity, no blowie uppie stuff, a few gunshots and a LOT of vehicular mayhem. Expect a couple of surprise cameos at the end...and watch your Amazon.com DVD all the way through the credits.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I only recently discovered this movie when watching an old interview with Kristen Bell, and as a big fan of hers, had to give it a try. I'm not the type who enjoys a "chick flick", although I do enjoy a good love story, and LOVE fast cars. Hit and Run is a great mix of action and off-beat humor involving a delightful mix of top-rate actors. Kristen and Dax's real life relationship played out well on the big screen to the point it was ridiculously cute!
summary: Quirky humor and tons of action
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Dax Shepard directed and starred in this snoozefest along with his real life girlfriend, Kristen Bell.The result is a confusing mélange of plots that I was never able to figure out.We first find Dax telling Kristen how much he loves her. This goes on and on. Then we have John Goodman suddenly appearing and he does his usual "F...F...F..." dialogue because he's supposed to be upset.Then we have another admirer of Kristen who becomes maniacal in his obsession to protect her from her current boyfriend.Then we have a scene of a motel room full of naked elderly people who look like they walked over from the set of The Walking Dead.Then...by this time I was dozing off and I still have no idea what the plot was all about.

reviewText: Note: May contain spoilers. Proceed with caution.In the world of film it's becoming increasingly apparent that a movie's title can make or break its success. You have the pop culture flicks like Transformers and Fast and Furious, the books-turned-movie franchises like Harry Potter and Twilight, everything else in between, and then you have Hit & Run. At first glance, nothing about the film is appealing: the title, the cover, the fact that Bradley Cooper is sporting dreadlocks. From the gate it already has so much going against it. So why was it so good? How is it possible that this film - which seemed destined to be a train wreck - managed to give me one of the funnest cinematic experiences I've had in months?Well, to be honest, there's multiple reasons. There's the honest chemistry between the two leads, the carefree script, and the overall fun nature of the film. There was never a point in Hit & Run where I went, "Ok, this is a bit much." In other words, I never felt overwhelmed. You have the action-oriented side of the film and then you have the comedic side. What Dax Shepard did extremely well was find that balance between the two. It never felt like he favored one of these elements over the other and it always felt genuine. Hell, he was even able to throw in a bit of romance and social commentary for good measure. I mean, why not right?Hit & Run follows the life of Charlie Bronson (Shepard), a man who was put into witness protection four years ago. He's currently living in Milton, California with his girlfriend Annie Bean (Kristen Bell), a professor at a local college. As we all know, you can't leave your area once you're put into witness protection. Unfortunately, Annie recently got offered an interview at the University of California for a job in the field she created herself. While hesitant at first, Charlie decides that she should go and that he would go with her. Things quickly get out of hand as Charlie and Annie are chased by Charlie's supervisor Randy (Tom Arnold), Annie's ex-boyfriend Gil (Michael Rosenbaum), and Charlie's ex-friend Alex (Cooper). All she wanted to do was go to her interview!What surprised me most was all the social commentary scattered throughout the film. Whether it was society's insensitiveness towards certain words like "f**", how we constantly stereotype people, or our constant impulse to judge someone because of their past instead of looking at who they are now; I mean, they covered it all. What made it better was the fact that it all felt natural. It didn't feel like they threw it in at the last second because they wanted to make the movie seem more appealing to a greater audience. Everything seemed to work perfectly and nothing felt out of place. Major props to Shepard for that.Also, the on-screen relationship between Charlie and Annie was very well written. While at times I felt Annie was being a bit annoying, especially when she found out the truth about Charlie, I loved that Charlie never got out of hand. He called her out on her being judgmental just like she called him out on being insensitive. Not only that, but the fact that Shepard and Bell are in a relationship in real life translates really well on screen. It helps breathe a certain purity to the characters' relationship which is something you don't see often. They're completely comfortable with each other which allows their relationship to feel authentic.Finally, the casting in the film is extremely well done. Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard are great together and part of that has to do with their relationship in real life. Then you have Tom Arnold who was a riot in almost every scene he was in. Similarly, Bradley Cooper gave another great performance as Alex. I don't know what it is about him, but he seems to nail every performance he takes on. As the film reaches it's final twenty minutes or so you're greeted with a few familiar faces. Beau Bridges appears as Charlie's dad, Jason Bateman appears as a U.S. Marshal, and Sean Hayes appears as Sandy Osterman, the professor who interviews Annie. It's always nice to see Bateman in a film and I can't even remember the last time I saw Sean Hayes in something.Overall Score: 8/10 - I must admit that I was not expecting to like this film as much as I did. It's smart, it's funny, and it's a fun ride from start to finish. It's one of those movies that doesn't try to achieve some big goal. It's there to entertain and that's exactly what it did. It does that all while giving you some great social commentary and a nice cast. Overall, Hit & Run is a very well-rounded movie that exceeded my expectations. Definitely recommend you check this out if you have the time.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I was afraid to locate the review page for "Hit and Run" with Dax Shepard and Kristen Bell. I did not like this movie--its characters, its premise, or its outcome. And I knew I would come here and discover that others did like the movie.The only reason I "rented" the thing is Bradley Cooper, whose talent is wasted here. Even if I had looked up reviews beforehand, I would have gotten all these four-star reviews, giving me a false positive. OK, here's what I didn't like:1. Shepard's unkempt, straggly hair2. Bell's character has a PHD, yet she is dressed in jeans for a serious job interview3. Tom Arnold plays a marshal, inept in every way. Tom, stop playing these demeaning roles. You actually have talent.4. Contains a silly app which helps find a gay partner5. Silly, immature plotWhat's to like then? Maybe that revved up car (but it was used in an inane car chase) and Cooper's blonde dreadlocks.I was not even slightly impressed with this film mess.
summary: Don't waste your time or money!
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I wasn't sure what to expect from this. Today was my day to catch up on some movies. Hit And Run was fairly low on my list but I went with my gut and rented it. Boy was I surprised. I like Dax Shepard and believe he's underrated. I love both Kristen Bell and Kristen Chenoweth. Bradley Cooper is okay for women but I don't like him as much. This movie has to be one of the funniest movies ever made. Everyone is great in it. It's sweet , it's funny , and it has car chases. Need I say more.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Hit and Run is a comedy about a young couple (Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard) that risks it all when they leave their small town life and embark on a road trip that may lead them towards the opportunity of a lifetime.The problem with this movie is that it cant make up its mind what it wants to be..is it a comedy, is it an action movie?  And normally a mix of the two would be fine, but in this case, it cant do either well.  The action is stupid and like the car chases goes in circles too many times.  The comedy is not funny and filled with boring monotonous lines that make you wish it was over and not wasting your time.Not worth a purchase or rent unless you want a B quality movie that is totally pointless in its plot.
summary: Action and comedy that doesnt do either well
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: This movie is ok, and had some genuinely funny moments. Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard, a real life and extremely charming couple, are great together in this movie. However, it felt like Shepard, who also wrote the movie, cast his favorite vehicles as co-stars.  There were a lot of really boring car chases that seemed to amount to sports cars doing donuts in the dirt. There were lots of clips of Shepard shifting gears and revving engines. It was more of a love story of a car aficionado than that of the main characters.At the end of the movie I just felt like they could have edited out twenty minutes of shots of car stuff, and made a tighter, more fun movie.Those of you out there that really like expensive cars may feel differently.
summary: Fancy cars do donuts in the dirt
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Loved this movie! A lot of action and humor. Tom Arnold was too funny. Very entertaining and a movie everyone will enjoy.

reviewText: Hit & Run is a action comedy about Charlie Bronson ( Dax Sheppard ) a former getaway driver for Bank Robbers  who's under the criminal witness protection and chooses to leave his protected area to take his girlfriend  Annie ( Kristeen Bell ) to Los Angeles for a great job chased by  monitoring officer ( Tom Arnold ) & Annie's jealous ex boyfriend ( Michael Rosenbaum ) and ex partners bank robbers Metropolis Alex ( Bradley Cooper ) & Alan ( Ryan Hansen ) & ex girlfriend Neve ( Joy Bryant ) and a car horsepower hillbilly ( David Koechner ) who is interested in Charlie's ( Dax Sheppard ) car a  700 horse powered 1977 Lincoln Continental  with a few laughs car chases that end up at Charlie Bronson Fathers ( Beau Bridges ) property  .The best thing about Hit & Run is the 1967 , 700 horse power Lincoln Continental with a good clear picture & sound  , an R Rated movie & approx  1.41 .

Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: The main theme of the story revolved on a ex-criminal, attempting to start fresh, engaged to his dream woman, and labored to settle down, marry, and have kids. The two people chosen to such roles were the best couple that represents the contrast of an ambitious young woman and a traumatized man with dark history. There was plenty of substance in such theme alone that could have made a greatly educational movie.But, the moviemaker opted to spoil the good part by plenty of gay practices, either to provoke, or to sell to target gay population. Even though the fact that prisons and jails are infected with sexual violations that should not be pushed under the rug, and their exposure is educational, yet the moviemaker went far and beyond to describe a network of gays in the police and US Marshals engaging in casual sex while on duty, performing their jobs, on the streets.The movie ended by a couple of straight people assuring each other during a job interview, followed by a couple of gay men doing the same during a job interview.Imposition spoiled the movie, not only on the forcible injection of improper gay agenda throughout the duration of the movie, but also on the shallow dialogue between a well-educated woman being fooled by an apparently impaired man whom she chose as a fiancee.Ironically, the movie entailed few good tricks that would also have enhanced the movie's appeal had its movieamker avoided the twist of advancing gay agenda.Mohamed F. El-Hewie
summary: Blatantly imposed gay agenda spoiled the good part of story
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: While Dax Shepard (writer, actor, co-director) didn't strike pay dirt with this romantic action comedy, he certainly put a smile on my face.  Shepard plays Charlie Bronson (nee Yul Perkins) who is in witness protection in a small northern California town.  He does strike gold, however, when he finds a loving relationship with Annie (real life mate Kristen Bell).  She is a professor at the local college but is about to lose her job due to budget cuts.Her boss is played by a hilarious Kristin Chenoweth.  Given Annie's doctorate is in nonviolent conflict resolution (admit it, that's funny) her options are limited.  She finds a possible job in Los Angeles, but that means if she drags Charlie along, he will have to leave his protected status.  Of course he does and that's when the Keystone Kops chase begins.One of his pursuers is an incompetent federal marshal (Tom Arnold) who is also a friend.  Another is Alex (a dreadlocked Bradley Cooper) who was Charlie/Yul's bank robbing partner.  He's accompanied by Yul's former girlfriend played by Joy Bryant who is also Shepard's lover on the TV show "Parenthood."  Then there's an old boyfriend (Michael Rosenbaum) of Annie's.  His gay brother is a county deputy sheriff looking for romance.Bell and Shepard are great together as they take time to argue about the use of a disparaging word for homosexuals and whether Charlie's hot rod Lincoln Continental is an appropriate vehicle for the couple.  Besides Chenoweth, Cooper steals most of his scenes especially after he confronts Charlie.  Granted some of the jokes fall flat and some of the bits just seem to be added for length.  But overall this is a pleasant, sometimes vulgar road trippin' movie with some terrific stunt driving.Warning:  You'll want to close your eyes when Charlie and Annie mistakenly walk in on a foursome of septuagenarians au naturale.
summary: 3 1/2 stars for a action based romantic comedy
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: This movie is absolutely hilarious. Everyone did an awesome job on this one. Tom Arnold absolutely nailed it, every scene he is in has a LOL moment, the bowling ball had me rolling. Bradley Cooper also nailed his part, especially with the dog food scene. I wasn't sure exactly how good Dax and Kristen were going to be together at first, just do to the fact that they are a couple, and sometimes that can be distractive for the actors in certain scenes, but they really pulled it off, with each of them having some nice LOL moments. Overall this is a great comedy with some awesome car chase scenes. You definitely shouldn't pass this movie up.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: A little slow, would've liked more action. Not a bad story line and it is funny. Quality of film from amazons instant video was good.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Way better than I was expecting, love sarcasm and little side comments. Definitely worth spending a night on the couch watching this!
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: This was a movie that caught me totally off guard.  I love a good romantic comedy and dark humor, and this one was just flat out cute.  The chemistry between Kristen Bell and Dax Shepherd is adorable.  Kristen Bell plays a classy, cute and very intelligent woman, and Dax Shepherd is the "used to be a bad boy" guy who just adores her for who she is.  Normally movies like that can seem so far fetched because you think what classy gorgeous woman would fall for a guy like that?  But in this movie it really works.  It's adorable.  Be advised, some people may be offended by some of the humor and the things they discuss.  Personally, I think that is partly what makes the movie work.  I think this movie falls somewhere in between the great car chase action of The Fast and The Furious combined with the cute dark romance of Gross Pointe Blank.
summary: Funny, dark humor and very cute love story
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: We enjoyed this silly little romp. Reminded me of planes, trains, and automobiles meet Smokey and the Bandit. If you are in the mood for mindless entertainment this will fill the bill.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I think Dax Sheperd and Kristen Bell have done funnier movies.  This was worth a watch, just do not purchase it, u will not watch again.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Unfortunately, it did not hold my attention and I stopped watching it mid way.  I can see what they were trying to go for with this movie but it was bleh.  The relationship with Kristen bell and Dax Shephard was cute and realistic, so that was nice.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Great story, great acting, very funny & one I will see again. I was pleasantly surprised to see that Dax wrote & directed!
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: How Dax Sheppered isn't blacklisted in Hollywood is beyond me. This was unfunny, showy, and lame. The action scenes consisted of him spinning donuts in the street. Wow, what a cool guy!! Sounds great doesn't it? Something was very depressing about this movie. Bradley Cooper was alright as always, but save this one for the FX channel at 3am if you must.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I will say up front that this movie is definitely not for everybody. My girlfriend didnt like it and wandered off like halfway through. As for me, I thought it was pretty funny and cool. This was certainly not a movie written in typical Hollywood fashion, but if you've ever watched anything Dax has written and/or directed before and enjoyed it, you'll probably like this. There arent really a lot of highs and lows. rather, it kind of meanders through an idea. In this case, the idea is that a relationship can survive quite a bit. I thought the acting was actually quite superior to previous efforts like "Let's Go To Prison" for example. I dont know. This isnt a movie that can be decided on by reading reviews in my opinion. You just gotta watch it and either like it or dont. It has that undefinable certain something that some people love and others hate. It does have some very recognizable people from Bradley Cooper to Tom Arnold, and of course Kristen Bell is no slouch either.Ultimately, I really enjoyed it, but dont expect a fast paced script, even with all the chase scenes and what have you. this movie is really more about introspection with a humorous delivery.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I basically like 3 types of movies: Action, Comedy and Action-Comedy.Amazon lists this as Action-Comedy (or possibly Comedy-Action). It is neither.It is NOT funny (except for Tom Arnold launching a bowling ball through a mini-van and Beau Bridges punching a guy for and extended period but together that amounts to 1 minute of screen time. In fact there is a cameo by David Koechner...in a semi-serious role, ie not funny).It has 4-5 car chases, each one about 5 minutes long. No serious car crashes, no big explosion. Near the end there is a car jump that is shown from like 10 different angles in slow-motion. None of it very exciting or compelling.This movie is mostly a lot of dialogue. Not action or comedy, just boring.
summary: I Guess I Just Don't Get It
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I found the movie to be humorous and an enjoyable watch.  Of course not the greatest movie I have ever seen, but well worth renting through the Instant Video Service.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: This movie wasn't what I expected. The first half of the movie is flat-out boring. Dax Shepard and Kristen Bell's love story felt awkward. Their lovey dovy dialog felt forced and was annoying. It wasn't until Bradley Cooper's character showed up that the movie became a little interesting. Yul Perkins is in witness protection because of this past. He has a new life and a new name; Charlie. He has a girlfriend named Annie that loves him, but she is offered a job in L.A. Charlie decides to take Annie to L.A., but they are soon stalked by Annie's ex boyfriend, Gil. Gil contacts Charlie's friend, Alex, who is wanting revenge and money that Charlie stole. I wouldn't recommend HIT & RUN!!!
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Worth the rental.  Fun and kinda funny.  I was entertained and that's all you can ask from a movie like this.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: A well written and well acted movie with good humor, good driving and a bit of believable romance. Worth It.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: This movie rocked. Dax Shepard does a great job as a leading man, and Kristen Bell is a charming leading lady. It doesn't hurt that they are real-life husband and wife - it makes their characters chemistry so real. You can imagine Dax pulled from conversations in their real relationship to write some of the scenes. AND - he also put awesomely funny characters, situations, and some kick-ass action. My husband and I were really impressed.
summary: So great - car chases and romantic dialog - something for everyone
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Having already enjoying the hilarious "Brother's Justice", I anxiously awaited Dax Shepard' next endeavor "Hit & Run"  I was not disappointed, as the writer, director, star struck again.  This movie is silly beyond description without one believable moment. How then can it be good? 1. Shepard meant it the way it plays. 2. Again he calls in personal friends, such as Bradley Cooper, Tom Arnold and Kristen Bell - plus as number of fellow performers that you know and enjoy.  When you watch this, be sure to watch all through the credits for some laughs.  Bradley Cooper made this gem and Silver Lining Playbook the same year, so if you wonder how broad his talent is, watch both films.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Critics were not kind to this movie, but I love it to the point of watching it over, over, and over.  The dialogue and plotting are perhaps the best of any movie in recent memory, and if a couple of the characters aren't as likable as you hoped they'd be, well, the cars make up for it.  There's some pretty good chase scenes too.  And amazingly, each chase scene actually forwards the plot along.  But in the end, the real stars here are the amazingly natural dialogue, the perfectly thought-out plot, and the beautiful cars.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: This was a good movie, though a bit predictable. The action was good and the pace was just right. I would watch again.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I watched this movie during a blizzard a few days ago so maybe I needed some comic relief. There are a few scenes that are laugh out loud funny and I am still laughing from them. It is not the funniest movie that I have ever seen (Bridesmaids), but it definitely made me laugh. Tom Arnold is always a hoot and the gay story arc fit in perfectly with the comedy. You will also love the cars. This movie is far from a masterpiece but it is a fun watch and will cheer you up for sure.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: HIT AND RUN is an odd, but oddly entertaining movie.  Not exactly a comedy.  Not a drama.  Not quite an action film.  I guess it could best be summarized as a comedic action romance.Dax Shepard plays Charles Bronson (not the movie star), a former bank robbery getaway driver who is currently in witness protection, currently living in small town California.  He's in a strong relationship with a community college teacher (Kristen Bell) and they seem blissfully happy.  Shepard is friendly with his hapless witness protection marshal (Tom Arnold, less annoying than usual), and other than the fact that Shepard doesn't seem to have an action job...all is well.Things are turned upside down, though, when Bell is a) fired from her current gig and b) given the opportunity to get her dream job at a university in Los Angeles.  Shepard decides he's going to leave his safe environment and follow her to LA...and this triggers a series of unfortunate events culminating in numerous chase scenes, confrontations and misunderstandings.  Eventually, Shepard must confront those whom he betrayed, including his former partner in crime, the Adidas track suit wearing, dreadlocked Bradley Cooper.  Measured chaos ensues.In some ways, this movie wants to be a breezy action comedy, light and fun.  But the script is also heavily focused on its dialogue, so it feels a little bit like a lightweight Tarantino film, with these scruffy characters being FAR TOO articulate.  Or, perhaps, it feels a little like an action film Woody Allen might have written.  And it tries a bit too hard to make Dax Shepard into a romantic figure.  He speaks poetically to Bell...he's Mr. Sensitive.  And the film was co-directed by Shepard...which to me means he didn't understand that he's not always convincing in this role.  There's no reason he can't be convincing as a romantic...but he's often filmed in dewy-eyed close-up.  He almost teeters into parody.  His character is interesting and unusual, but not always convincing.  I guess if I had to sum it up, it appears that Shepard wanted HIT AND RUN to be the vehicle that turned him into a star...and he misses the mark fairly widely.Kristen Bell is pleasant enough, but I didn't feel her character was as well rounded.  And the frequent close-ups on her face, unfortunately, revealed the copious amounts of makeup she was wearing.  I mention this because I'm NEVER aware of this sort of thing...but her character is supposed to be "Fresh-faced" and thus, the heavy makeup was a bit jarring.  I admit, this is a really minor quibble...but for some reason, it stood out for me.Cooper, though an unbelievable character in many ways, is perhaps the most purely amusing character.  He's ridiculous and dangerous.  The conception of his character is over-the-top, yet he downplays it and makes it as "real" as possible.The movie is peppered with interesting cameos.  Kristen Chenoweth and Sean Hayes come across as bad caricatures.  Jason Bateman appears in a scene for no good reason.  David Koechner pops up.  Beau Bridges actually has a couple of nice moments.There are chase scenes, but in general, they are not anything special.  (Although good laughs are to be had at the expense of Tom Arnold and the mini-van he drives.)  The scenery is lovely.  There are certainly scattered laughs to be had throughout, and the film was never dull.  But it's just too quirky in an uncontrolled way to really work.  I give it a VERY modest recommendation, because it does have a fair amount of imagination and originality.  But it can't quite shake the "Dax Shepard vanity project" vibe, and thus is less than satisfying.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Good actors in bad movies are becoming more common place, but we shouldn't give up that real movie makers are still out there. This movie is disjointed and often not funny. Predictable and boring, the plot is non-sense and meaningless.  I know actors have to start somewhere and they often are better than the movies they're in, but come on already.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: A well presented story with charismatic personalities and plenty of strangeness to make you laugh! You will not regret an evening watching this one.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: This movie really surprised both my Husband and I. It was charming, sweet and had really good chemistry within the whole cast. Bradley Cooper with dreadlocks and a warm heart for dogs, was pretty darn awesome. Just watch it. It was worth it. Made us all laugh a lot. I personally LOVE Kirsten Bell and Dax Shepard. Kirsten Bell is an actress from Veronica Mars (which was AN AMAZING SHOW, now thanks to it's fans will now be A MOVIE! YES!) and Dax Shepard plays the lovable Crosby on Parenthood. His character on Parenthood is flawed and real. I love that. So, it was the perfect movie, with the perfect cast. It also helped that it was directed really well. Loved the shots and the mood. Just a great flick all around. :D
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: The preview appeared to present a good movie, but in reality this was a drag. The plot was muddled and the story line was winding. There were scenes that were akward and poorly filmed. There was a room full of elderly nudists that has scared me for about a year.  I can not hear a song by Earth Wind and Fire without getting grossed out. If I could charge them a star for the honor of watching this mess, I would demand payment.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: A birthday gift for my son.  He enjoyed the movie in the theatre and wanted to have it to watch at home.  Good movie
summary: A birthday gift for my son.  He enjoyed the movie in the theatre and wanted to have it to watch at home.  Good movie
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I saw this in theaters with my fiance and we both loved it which is really rare for us. Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard have a wonderful chemistry and rhythm that I can only assume comes from their real life relationship and Michael Rosenbaum, Tom Arnold, Bradley Cooper, and Kristin Chenoweth are all hysterical in this! I don't know much about cars but my fiance was practically drooling over them. Great as a date movie or just a fun movie night!
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: The redeeming part of this movie was the chemistry between Kristen bell and her hubby in real life. There were some slightly humorous parts, but they were trying too hard. I was dissappointed and would  not recommend.
summary: Slightly humorous with a lot of language
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: This was entertaining.  Tom Arnold's character is funny.  The movie follows a woman and her boyfriend as they travel both across the country and trhough what they thought was their relationship.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Dax and Bell...real couple...are great in this together. You can see their affection for each other. Dreadlocked Bradley is cute. Mindless fun.  I enjoyed it.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: turned it off after 20 minutes.  kristen bell is cute, but tom arnold bumbling for comedy isn't funny.  wanted to like it.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I'm not really sure how I feel about this movie.  I think how much I like this movie would depend on the mood I'm in when I watch it.  The graphic nudity - in two scenes - is not what anyone would be expecting.  The first scene, when I saw it, made me cringe and want to "blow my groceries", but the second scene I knew what to expect and found it somewhat comical.  The movie wanders all over the place and is not very believable, at least in my opinion.  I'm not a Tom Arnold fan at all, but this movie was perfect for him and he did a great job as a bumbling Marshall.  He was my favorite part of the movie.  Would I buy it for more than $5?  No way.  Would I watch it again?  Maybe.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Good not great.  Funny in many spots.  Kept waiting for something to happen.  Wish I had waited for it to be free
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: This show was fun to watch with funny characters that anyone could relate too.  Recommended for a good saturday or sunday afternoon watch.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Very entertaining and funny. Has a good storyline from start to finish and the acting is good. Enjoyed it very much
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I'm 20 minutes into the movie and have already rewound 2 scenes to watch again. I'm impressed by Dax Shepard's moves in this film.Kristen Bell is, as always, very likeable. Good Movie.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: We watched the trailer and thought it looked good. We also thought it could be one of those situations where everything funny was in the trailer. Wrong, wrong, wrong. We loved it. I thought Tom Arnold over acted a bit, but hey. Love Kristen Bell. She's been one of my new favorites since 'Forgetting Sarah Marshall'. No disappointments there. Funny script, well played. Take the off chance, you won't regret it.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: It is probably my own fault I did not enjoy this movie more.  I got interrupted several times and was in the process of moving, so was unable to give it my full attention.I loved the idea of the plot, have liked most of the movies the other actors have been in, and think they provided most of the reason it held my attention, (or lack of due to circumstances).  For me it provided a constant, low key humor, which was a nice distraction and Chang of pace from my usual choice of drama's, foreignMystery, and action.The main negative was the complete unrealistic approach to realty, but I guess that was the idea.  I could never buy into the witness p. program being handled in such a fashion, at the same time once I let go of what "would be", I enjoyed the complete impossibility of it all and just rode with it.  Have seen better, probably would not watch again, but would suggest to a friend if they were looking for some low key entertainment.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I was really happy that I took a chance on this movie.Twisted and funny!!! Will definitely be watching this movie again.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: I was not sure if I liked it or hated it. It really did not appel to me. Tom Arnold did a great job as the comedy relief in the movie, but I am not sure about the other characters. The characters did not have much depth to them. I am sorry but it left me a little confused.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Charles (Dax Shepard), not his real name, is in the Witness Protection Program (WPP) in the sleepy little town of Milton. Randy (Tom Arnold) who is a fallen from grace, inept federal marshal is assigned to watch over him. Annie (Kristen Bell) is Charles' girlfriend. She knows he is in the Program, but not the details. Gil (Michael Rosenbaum) is Annie's ex-bf who is still in love with her.When Annie gets offered a job in LA, Charles insists she go take it, and he opts to drive her himself in his 700 HP "suicide doors" Lincoln. They are chased by Gil, Randy, Gil's brother Terry (Jess Rowland) who is a gay policeman, and bad guy Alex (Bradley Cooper), the reason why Charles is in the WPP to begin with.The film turns into "Smokey and the Bandit" with gun fire. The unorthodox relationship of the two stars is the heart of the film. Annie is an expert in solving non-violent conflict solutions and Charles is...well let's say he is trying.The second half of the film digresses. I won't say it falls off a cliff, but it could have been done better in this romantic action/comedy.Parental Guide: F-bombs, some really ugly nudity, male nudity.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Weak plot trying to support itself with a few chase scenes.  Loaded with semi-funny prat falls and ends with a (not that there's anything wrong with that) gay marriage.  Love conquers all, don't care about myself, let's take care of you plot.  Worth the distraction on the plane.
summary: Low Budget Movie Gives Equal Enjoyment
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: This movie was not funny - all the actors in this have been good in other movies, but the timing and dialog were pretty horrible.  They also added insult to injury by slipping in some PC lectures by the annoying girlfriend character...wow, if you don't like that in real life, imagine how annoying it is to be lectured off and on in an unfunny movie that you paid for...If you have ever sat in an odd position on your leg, had it fall asleep, pondered the odd sensation and wondered what it would be like if that happened to your mind...then watch this.  Otherwise, give this one a pass!
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Although we thought "Hit and Run" was a good movie, I think it was somewhat just like a two hour cat and mouse chase at times. The actors and actresses are definitely this movie's saving grace, as Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard have a great dynamic, and who doesn't love the rest of the cast?
summary: Great group of actors and actresses, but....
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Pretty okay. Dialog could have been a little less contrived, but overall it's an entertaining movie. Worth a watch. Yep.
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: The movie was more than I expected. I was a nice surprise. Becoming more and more of a fan of Dax since Parenthood.
summary: Cute fun movie even the guys will enjoy
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: "For the next 24 hours I know where Yul Perkins is." Charles Bronson (Shepard) and Annie (Bell) have been dating for awhile when Annie gets a job offer in LA. Charles offers to drive her. Along the way they are followed by his witness protection officer, Annie's ex boyfriend and the crew Bronson turned on. This is a very entertaining movie. The movie itself is very OK, but it is both funny and full of action and very much worth watching. The dialog is pretty funny but the situations the characters get into are great and you want to keep watching to see what happens next. This is in no way an Oscar type movie and won't make any top ten lists but if you are looking for a fun movie to just put in and watch then this is the one for you. There really isn't anything more to say about this movie other then I did enjoy it and had fun watching. Overall, fun and exciting. I give it a B+.
summary: A very entertaining and funny movie that is very much worth watching. A great movie to just put in and watch. I say B+
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: Dax Shepard writes, stars and co-directs (with David Palmer) in "Hit and Run," a comedy about "Charles Bronson" living in a small town in California, with his girlfriend Annie Bean (Kristen Bell). "Charles Bronson" is shocked to hear that Annie, specializing in nonviolent conflict resolution, has a job interview for a department chair position in Los Angeles. But "Charles Bronson" - of course, this is not his real name - cannot go to Los Angeles, where he left his troubled past four years ago.Well, in fact the film is nothing serious. Filled with quirky dialogue and eccentric characters, "Hit and Run" is an action comedy that leans towards comedy, or comedy of off-the-wall humor. Made on a budget of $2 million (half of which was reportedly spent to secure music rights), the action scenes of "Hit and Run" are modest at best.As a comedy, however, this is really a mixed bag. The leading characters are likable, with charming Kristen Bell, but their storyline is predictable and forgettable. The antics are unpredictable and often funny, but random and repetitions. Cars are so cool, and so is the soundtrack music. Oh, and I almost forgot Bradley Cooper. He plays a role that is not very interesting."Hit and Run" is a comedy, uneven in tone, with more creative ideas than its generic title suggests, but really in need of a better script.
summary: Uneven Comedy with Great Soundtrack Music and Nice-Looking Cars
Title: Hit & Run

reviewText: This movie was funny enough and the action seemed strained. Bradley C should never everrrr wear dreads. totally unremarkable acting and seems like there was more contract obligation rather than good scripting.
Title: Hit & Run
